Evaluation_Questions: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken
What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: 3 hours
3 hours spent typically on readings and weekly reflections.

There is a lot of reading and you are expected to do it. I would say I spent 2 hours reading a week. There was more workload for your group presentation and a lot of work for the research proposal at the end.
15 hours
I spent approximately 3-4 hours per week of the course of the semester, though the number did appropriately increase when large assignments were due.
3-5 hours per week
I loved the intimacy of this seminar, everyone spoke and created a safe space for everybody.
great course, very engaging and interesting
One of the most stimulating classes I've taken.

Very good, learned a lot. Everything Becca chose to do seemed intentional. The discussions could have been better at the beginning of the semester but I think people just took a few weeks to feel open with each other to discuss freely.
overall the course was executed excellently as it allowed for student engagement and creativity to learn the theories in health and aging.

This was an amazing class. The seminar style invited students to participate and share their unique stories in a supportive environment. I really appreciated every single assignment we did as it increased my understanding of the topics we discussed in class. The feedback on my work was phenomenal and truly thought provoking. This caused me to positively alter my work and think about topics.

This was an excellent course. The structure was clear and expectations were established at the beginning of the semester. Student-led discussions anchored the course and allowed us to dive deeply into several topics. The guest speakers were excellent. My one piece of feedback - the Canvas site was a bit tricky to navigate. It might have been easier if assignments could be submitted on Canvas, to help us keep track of deadlines. The readings (in "Course Reserves" this semester) would have been easier to access if they were in folders under "Files."

Really great course that covers many aspects of the health and aging process, highly recommend! Strengths: wonderful professor, students work in groups to lead one class, seminar-style class with lots of discussions, really good guest speakers, students learn to write a research proposal. Weakness: maybe a smaller class would allow for deeper discussions.

The structure of the course is excellent from how the desks are arranged to facilitate discussion to how we group lead a week once per semester. The course also covered a wide range of topics that made it relevant to all and was thought-provoking.
Course was amazing - allowed for lots of discussion and created a sense of openness among the students.
I really enjoyed the deep dive into various aspects of aging and the depth of learning and discussion.
wonderful class!
This is a great class! Professor Levy is awesome and the material is very interesting.

I really enjoyed the seminar structure of the class, which is unlike other classes I've taken at YSPH. All the students got to share their points of view. The topic of the course is interesting and it covers a wide breath of topics related to aging. I think the course would be even better if the first weeks of class already had readings assigned so that there could be more time at the end of the semester for final project presentations or other discussions.
Professor Levy was compassionate, kind, and encouraged us to really reflect. I enjoyed our insightful conversations and how candid she was.
Becca makes sure our class environment is engaging and safe. She provides great feedback and puts a lot of thought into her feedback on papers and weekly assignments
Excellent!
I really liked Becca. She had very good insight, picked readings well, every guest lecturer was interesting and well timed. I appreciated the feedback we got on our reflection papers.

the professor is very insightful and thoughtful when providing feedback for each assignment. she also provides enough guidance to lead classes while allowing for students to be creative in teaching course content.

Dr. Levy was incredibly well-versed in her topic and cared for every single student. She was very focused on each of us gaining an understanding and appreciation for the topics discussed in class. Her caring and enthusiasm was clearly evident in each class session. She was very responsive to any questions that arose. Her feedback on assignments was incredible!

Dr. Levy is incredibly knowledgeable on aging-related topics and established a positive learning environment. Of all of the professors I have had at YSPH, none has given more thorough or prompt feedback to weekly responses and other assignments. I appreciated Dr. Levy's insightful comments, and that she was able to get them to us the day after submission of our weekly responses.

Great professor! She's an expert in the field and is a wonderful instructor. She's very helpful to students as we planned our student-led classes. She's also very encouraging and gives timely and constructive feedback!
Professor Levy is excellent. She provides great feedback and is always wanting to push us to think about these topics in a new light.
Dr. Levy demonstrated her breadth and depth of knowledge in aging health issues throughout the course.
Dr. Levy was an amazing instructor and it was great having an expert in the field leading this course.
amazing instructor!

She was very supportive in all aspects of the class, and really gave us freedom to take our assignments and projects in the directions we wanted to explore. She also gave very helpful and timely feedback.
The professor was very knowledgeable and helped all the groups when they were leading the discussion each week. She was also very good at giving feedback for our reading responses and final projects.
highly recommend if you enjoy a breadth of interesting reading assignments, and a small course where your thoughts/opinions are valued
I would highly recommend this course with Professor Levy

I would recommend the course-you get a broad overview on health and aging and all the material is doable and interesting. Additionally, you learn a lot from your peers as people come from diverse backgrounds-policy, AP students etc.

overall I would recommend the course since it is such a unique yet rewarding class to take. the success of the class is dependent on the student body within the class and participation is critical to keeping the discussion flowing.

I would recommend this class to every single student in the public health school. The topic is incredible important and relevant, but aside from that, the feedback you receive from Dr. Levy will transform your work!

Yes, highly recommend if you're interested in learning more about the aging process or about the elderly in our society. You learn many aspects health & aging and leave the class with a better perspective of the elderly population. Even if you're remotely interested, I highly recommend you shop it.
Absolutely - very critical course for thinking about how we address the demographic population shifts around the world.
I would highly recommend for anyone to take this course, even if aging health is not your main focus!
wonderful--highly recommend!
Definitely take this class if you are interested in aging!
If you are interested in the topic of aging, I think this will be a great course to take. Be prepared to read a lot of articles and participate in class.
